intro: Xyris yutajensis, commonly known as the Yutajensis yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of northern Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Xyridaceae, which includes various species of grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Xyris yutajensis typically grows in swampy or seasonally flooded areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it an important component of the region's wetland ecosystems.
